entry.def: Philosophical means concerned with or relating to philosophy.

example.ex: He was not accustomed to political or philosophical discussions.
example.tran: 他不习惯政治或哲学讨论。

entry.def: Someone who is philosophical does not get upset when disappointing or disturbing things happen.

example.ex: Lewis has grown philosophical about life.
example.tran: 对于生活，刘易斯变得豁达洒脱了。

means.word_mean: 1. of or relating to philosophy or philosophers;
2. characterized by the attitude of a philosopher; meeting trouble with level-headed detachment;
3. characteristic of or imbued with the attitude of a philosopher or based on philosophy;

sentences.sentence: "that breadth of outlook that distinguishes the philosophic mind"

auth_sentence.content: Descartes certainly played down his own purely philosophical writings.
auth_sentence.res_content: Descartes certainly played down his own purely philosophical writings.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Descartes certainly played down his own purely philosophical writings.

auth_sentence.content: He also began to shape his own philosophical views.
auth_sentence.res_content: He also began to shape his own philosophical views.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He also began to shape his own philosophical views.

auth_sentence.content: The implications run from the practical to the philosophical.
auth_sentence.res_content: The implications run from the practical to the philosophical.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The implications run from the practical to the philosophical.

Sentence.sentence: The independence created by philosophical insight is—in my opinion—the mark of distinction between a mere artisan (工匠) or specialist and a real seeker after truth," Einstein wrote in 1944.

sentences.en: The teacher couldn’t answer the philosophical problem.
sentences.cn: 老师不能解答这个哲学问题。

sentences.en: She is very philosophical about her bad luck.
sentences.cn: 她对自己的不幸看得很开。
